items.title: Netflix to Buy Warner Bros. in $72 Billion Cash, Stock Deal | Bloomberg Tech 12/5/2025
items.standfirst: Bloomberg’s Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow discuss Netflix’s agreement to buy Warner Bros. Discovery after it completes the planned spinoff of its cable channels. Plus, the European Union Ambassador to the US responds to criticism of the $140 million fine the bloc has levied on Elon Musk’s social media platform X. And HPE CEO, Antonio Neri, discusses the company’s outlook after reporting disappointing 4Q AI server sales. (Source: Bloomberg)
items.content: Bloomberg’s Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow discuss Netflix’s agreement to buy Warner Bros. Discovery after it completes the planned spinoff of its cable channels. Plus, the European Union Ambassador to the US responds to criticism of the $140 million fine the bloc has levied on Elon Musk’s social media platform X. And HPE CEO, Antonio Neri, discusses the company’s outlook after reporting disappointing 4Q AI server sales. (Source: Bloomberg)

items.title: HPE’s AI Servers Ready as Soon Data Centers Are, Says CEO
items.standfirst: HPE CEO Antonio Neri discusses the company’s earnings as its sales for AI servers fall short. He joins Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on “Bloomberg Tech”. (Source: Bloomberg)
items.content: HPE CEO Antonio Neri discusses the company’s earnings as its sales for AI servers fall short. He joins Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on “Bloomberg Tech”. (Source: Bloomberg)

items.title: Netflix, Warner Bros. Face Road to Finalizing Deal
items.standfirst: Finalizing the deal between Netflix and Warner Bros. Discovery will be a longer and bigger fight than Game of Thrones, says Jon Klein, co-founder of Hang Media. The former head of CNN discusses the challenges facing the tie-up and the competition Netflix faces from YouTube and the creator economy. He speaks with Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on "Bloomberg Tech." (Source: Bloomberg)
items.content: Finalizing the deal between Netflix and Warner Bros. Discovery will be a longer and bigger fight than Game of Thrones, says Jon Klein, co-founder of Hang Media. The former head of CNN discusses the challenges facing the tie-up and the competition Netflix faces from YouTube and the creator economy. He speaks with Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on "Bloomberg Tech." (Source: Bloomberg)

items.title: Netflix Breaks From ‘Build, Not Buy’ With Warner Bros. Deal
items.standfirst: Netflix agrees to buy Warner Bros. Discovery in a historic $72 billion cash and stock deal. Bloomberg’s Lucas Shaw discusses the combination of the world’s dominant paid streaming service with one of Hollywood’s oldest and most revered studios. He joins Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on “Bloomberg Tech.” (Source: Bloomberg)
items.content: Netflix agrees to buy Warner Bros. Discovery in a historic $72 billion cash and stock deal. Bloomberg’s Lucas Shaw discusses the combination of the world’s dominant paid streaming service with one of Hollywood’s oldest and most revered studios. He joins Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on “Bloomberg Tech.” (Source: Bloomberg)

items.title: Netflix–Warner Bros. Deal Sets Up $72 Billion Antitrust Test

items.content: Netflix Inc. has won the heated takeover battle for Warner Bros. Discovery Inc. Now it must convince global antitrust regulators that the deal won’t give it an illegal advantage in the streaming market.

items.title: ‘This merger must be blocked’: Netflix-Warner Bros deal faces fierce backlash

Continue reading...

items.title: EU Can Regulate Tech, Bloc's US Ambassador Says
items.standfirst: European Union Ambassador to the US Jovita Neliupšienė talks about why bloc fined Elon Musk's X social network €120 million ($140 million) for violating a content-moderation law. She says the European Commission doesn’t target any one country or company with its rules. She discusses the EU’s approach to tech, defense, and the use of frozen Russian funds to support Ukraine's war effort. She joins Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on "Bloomberg Tech." (Source: Bloomberg)
items.content: European Union Ambassador to the US Jovita Neliupšienė talks about why bloc fined Elon Musk's X social network €120 million ($140 million) for violating a content-moderation law. She says the European Commission doesn’t target any one country or company with its rules. She discusses the EU’s approach to tech, defense, and the use of frozen Russian funds to support Ukraine's war effort. She joins Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on "Bloomberg Tech." (Source: Bloomberg)

items.title: Netflix to Buy Warner Bros. in Historic $72 Billion Deal
items.standfirst: Netflix Inc. agreed to buy Warner Bros. Discovery Inc., marking a seismic shift in the entertainment business as a Silicon Valley-bred streaming giant tries to swallow one of Hollywood’s oldest and most revered studios.
items.content: Netflix Inc. agreed to buy Warner Bros. Discovery Inc., marking a seismic shift in the entertainment business as a Silicon Valley-bred streaming giant tries to swallow one of Hollywood’s oldest and most revered studios.

items.title: Musk’s X Fined as EU Escalates Free-Speech Clash With US
items.standfirst: Elon Musk’s X social network was slapped with a lower-than-expected €120 million ($140 million) fine for violating the European Union’s controversial content-moderation law, in a move still set to raise tensions with the White House over free speech and tech regulation.
items.content: Elon Musk’s X social network was slapped with a lower-than-expected €120 million ($140 million) fine for violating the European Union’s controversial content-moderation law, in a move still set to raise tensions with the White House over free speech and tech regulation.

The merger could reshape the entertainment industry for decades.
Lawmakers and unions warn of potential destabilization in Hollywood.
Netflix's acquisition could give it expansive power over the industry.

items.title: Police 'naturally' recover a $19,000 Fabergé egg swallowed by alleged thief
items.standfirst: Police in New Zealand said Friday that they had recovered a Fabergé egg pendant worth $19,000, six days after a man was accused of swallowing it at a jewelry store in an effort to steal it
items.content: Police in New Zealand said Friday that they had recovered a Fabergé egg pendant worth $19,000, six days after a man was accused of swallowing it at a jewelry store in an effort to steal it

items.title: Patient police say they have recovered Fabergé pendant from man accused of swallowing it
items.standfirst: Six days after alleged incident, evidence emerges without requiring medical intervention, New Zealand police sayPolice say they have recovered a Fabergé egg pendant from a man accused of swallowing the item in a jewellery story.New Zealand police have spent six days monitoring every bowel movement of the suspect, a spokesperson said, and the NZ$33,000 ($19,000) James Bond Octopussy pendant was recovered from his gastrointestinal tract on Thursday night by natural means, without requiring medical intervention. Continue reading...
items.content: Six days after alleged incident, evidence emerges without requiring medical intervention, New Zealand police sayPolice say they have recovered a Fabergé egg pendant from a man accused of swallowing the item in a jewellery story.New Zealand police have spent six days monitoring every bowel movement of the suspect, a spokesperson said, and the NZ$33,000 ($19,000) James Bond Octopussy pendant was recovered from his gastrointestinal tract on Thursday night by natural means, without requiring medical intervention. Continue reading...

items.title: At least 11 killed in South Africa mass shooting

items.content: Gunmen stormed a hostel near Pretoria and opened fire, killing 11 people including a three-year-old.

items.title: Gunmen kill at least 11 people including three-year-old in South African hostel
items.standfirst: Total of 25 people shot in early morning Pretoria attack, with victims including 12-year-old boy and 16-year-old girlGunmen have stormed into a hostel in South Africa’s capital and killed at least 11 people, including a three-year-old child, and injured more than a dozen others.“I can confirm that a total of 25 people were shot,” police spokesperson Athlenda Mathe said of the early morning attack in Pretoria. She said 14 people had been hospitalised. Continue reading...

She said 14 people had been hospitalised. Continue reading...

items.standfirst: This blog is now closed, you can read more on this story hereRussia and India will reshape their defence ties to take account of New Delhi’s push for self-reliance, the two countries said in a joint statement after a summit between president Putin and Indian prime minister Narendra Modi.“In response to India’s aspirations for self-reliance, the partnership is currently being reoriented toward joint research and development, as well as the production of advanced defence platforms,” the statement said. Continue reading...
items.content: This blog is now closed, you can read more on this story hereRussia and India will reshape their defence ties to take account of New Delhi’s push for self-reliance, the two countries said in a joint statement after a summit between president Putin and Indian prime minister Narendra Modi.“In response to India’s aspirations for self-reliance, the partnership is currently being reoriented toward joint research and development, as well as the production of advanced defence platforms,” the statement said. items.title: Putin vows oil shipments to India will be ‘uninterrupted’ in defiance of US
items.standfirst: Narendra Modi says energy security is ‘pillar of the India-Russia partnership’ as two leaders meet in DelhiVladimir Putin has told the Indian prime minister, Narendra Modi, that Russia is ready to continue “uninterrupted” shipments of oil to India, signalling a defiant stance to the US as the two leaders met in Delhi and affirmed that their ties were “resilient to external pressure”.The statement, made on Friday after the annual India-Russia summit, appeared to be directed at western countries – particularly the US – that have attempted to pressure New Delhi into scaling back its ties to Moscow. Continue reading...
items.content: Narendra Modi says energy security is ‘pillar of the India-Russia partnership’ as two leaders meet in DelhiVladimir Putin has told the Indian prime minister, Narendra Modi, that Russia is ready to continue “uninterrupted” shipments of oil to India, signalling a defiant stance to the US as the two leaders met in Delhi and affirmed that their ties were “resilient to external pressure”.The statement, made on Friday after the annual India-Russia summit, appeared to be directed at western countries – particularly the US – that have attempted to pressure New Delhi into scaling back its ties to Moscow. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Putin pledged uninterrupted oil shipments to India.
Both nations set a $100 billion trade goal.
The leaders affirmed ties are resilient to pressure.
India and Russia will reshape defense ties.
The statement was directed at Western countries.

items.title: Waymo Plans Software Recall to Address Bus Incidents
items.standfirst: Waymo said it will file a voluntary software recall with US federal authorities after its autonomously driven vehicles repeatedly failed to fully slow or stop for school buses.
items.content: Waymo said it will file a voluntary software recall with US federal authorities after its autonomously driven vehicles repeatedly failed to fully slow or stop for school buses.

The software update aims to improve safety around school bus operations.

clusters.title: Netflix’s $5.8 Billion Breakup Fee for Warner Among Largest Ever
clusters.neutral_headline: Netflix's $5.8 Billion Breakup Fee for Warner Among Largest Ever

items.title: Netflix’s $5.8 Billion Breakup Fee for Warner Among Largest Ever
Netflix’s $5.8 Billion Breakup Fee for Warner Among Largest Ever
items.standfirst: Netflix Inc.’s $72 billion acquisition of Warner Bros. Discovery Inc. includes one of the biggest breakup fees of all time — a $5.8 billion penalty that Netflix has agreed to pay its target if the deal falls apart or fails to win regulatory approval.
items.content: Netflix Inc.’s $72 billion acquisition of Warner Bros. Discovery Inc. includes one of the biggest breakup fees of all time — a $5.8 billion penalty that Netflix has agreed to pay its target if the deal falls apart or fails to win regulatory approval.

This fee is payable if the deal fails or lacks regulatory approval.
The $5.8 billion penalty is one of the largest breakup fees ever.
The acquisition is valued at $72 billion.
The fee is a financial safeguard for Warner Bros. in the deal.

clusters.title: Rep. Adelita Grijalva says she was pepper sprayed during ICE raid
clusters.neutral_headline: Arizona Congresswoman Says She Was Pepper Sprayed at Protest

items.title: Rep. Adelita Grijalva says she was pepper sprayed during ICE raid
items.standfirst: Democratic Rep. Adelita Grijalva of Arizona said Friday she was pepper-sprayed by ICE during a raid at a Tucson restaurant. A Homeland Security spokesperson denied Grijalva's account.
items.content: Democratic Rep. Adelita Grijalva of Arizona said Friday she was pepper-sprayed by ICE during a raid at a Tucson restaurant. A Homeland Security spokesperson denied Grijalva's account.

items.title: Arizona congresswoman says she was ‘pepper sprayed’ at protest against ICE
items.standfirst: Adelita Grijalva, a Democratic representative, said she was ‘sprayed in the face’ at demonstration outside a restaurantAdelita Grijalva, an Arizona congressperson, said she was “sprayed in the face” during a protest against a federal immigration raid at a Mexican restaurant in Tucson on Friday.In a video filmed after the incident, Grijalva said she joined a group of protesters assembled outside Taco Giro, a “small mom-and-pop” restaurant in Tucson Grijalva said she visits weekly. By the time she arrived, she said, the protesters had “stopped” a squadron of dozens of mostly masked Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) agents. Continue reading...
items.content: Adelita Grijalva, a Democratic representative, said she was ‘sprayed in the face’ at demonstration outside a restaurantAdelita Grijalva, an Arizona congressperson, said she was “sprayed in the face” during a protest against a federal immigration raid at a Mexican restaurant in Tucson on Friday.In a video filmed after the incident, Grijalva said she joined a group of protesters assembled outside Taco Giro, a “small mom-and-pop” restaurant in Tucson Grijalva said she visits weekly. By the time she arrived, she said, the protesters had “stopped” a squadron of dozens of mostly masked Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) agents. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Representative Adelita Grijalva said she was pepper-sprayed during an ICE raid.
The incident occurred at a protest outside a Tucson restaurant.
A Homeland Security spokesperson denied Grijalva's account of the event.
Grijalva was protesting against a federal immigration raid.
The protest took place outside a Mexican restaurant in Tucson.

clusters.neutral_headline: Netflix to buy Warner Bros. in a deal valued at $82.7 billion

items.title: Netflix to buy Warner Bros. in a deal valued at $82.7 billion
items.standfirst: Netflix on Friday said it will acquire Warner Bros., including its film and television studios, HBO Max and HBO.
items.content: Netflix on Friday said it will acquire Warner Bros., including its film and television studios, HBO Max and HBO.

items.title: What Netflix's $82.7 billion deal to buy Warner Bros. means for viewers
items.standfirst: Netflix said it is buying Warner Bros. in a deal valued at $82.7 billion, merging the biggest streaming service with a storied studio that has produced films such as "Casablanca" and the "Harry Potter" franchise. Elaine Quijano has more on what it means for those watching at home.
items.content: Netflix said it is buying Warner Bros. in a deal valued at $82.7 billion, merging the biggest streaming service with a storied studio that has produced films such as "Casablanca" and the "Harry Potter" franchise. Elaine Quijano has more on what it means for those watching at home.

items.title: Netflix to buy Warner Bros film and streaming businesses for $72bn
items.standfirst: The major Hollywood deal means Netflix will takeover ownership of franchises including Harry Potter and Game of Thrones.
items.content: The major Hollywood deal means Netflix will takeover ownership of franchises including Harry Potter and Game of Thrones.
